Guy Hamilton.Action: Responds politely and attentively to Kumar upon arrival, thanking him and engaging in conversation.
Expresses anger and frustration about Potter leaving without notice and failing to introduce him to contacts.
Does not show visible gratitude or try to comfort Kumar when given bad news about Potter leaving, appearing more focused on his own disappointment.
Smiles and invites Kumar in to have a beer.
Thanks Kumar for coming to get him, acknowledges the help.
Reacts to Kumar calling him 'Boss' with a clear outlining of their relationship but allows it to pass without offense.
Accepts luggage from Kumar without hesitation and interacts politely and confidently with him, maintaining composure under surveillance.
Shows slight unease ('feels slightly queasy') possibly indicating some internal worry or awareness of being watched, which could suggest vulnerability but also situational awareness.
After rain begins, looks back with sheer delight at the place, showing optimism and a confident attitude toward his environment.
Introduces himself politely to the group and acknowledges Wally's work with a mild compliment.
Responds to Curtis' challenge with a calm, somewhat resigned comment about professionalism.
Expresses hope that his predecessor 'dies' (said sarcastically).
Introduces himself confidently to other journalists and engages in professional banter, demonstrating social ease and awareness.
Acknowledges the difficulties of the assignment and expresses realistic expectations about the reception he will get, showing professionalism.
Shrugs off the challenge with a casual 'O.K.', which might suggest some lack of deep engagement or initiative.

Admits the posting was something he put on his list but does not elaborate on any specific preparations or strategies, indicating moderate competence but with no strong evidence for high capability yet.
Chooses to drink local Indonesian beer despite warnings, showing willingness to embrace local culture and respect for host
Chooses to drink the local Indonesian beer despite being warned against it, showing openness to local culture and confidence in his choice.
Considers both the imported and local beer before making a choice, indicating thoughtfulness and situational assessment.
Engages fairly well with locals and colleagues, demonstrating social awareness and cultural adaptability.
Engages in conversation, asks relevant questions about current events (e.g., 'Does Sukarno still hold his press conference?').
Shakes his head at the mention of 'The Year of Living Dangerously,' showing lack of familiarity or understanding.
Refuses to get a bungalow and stay among the locals, stating 'I'm a journalist, not a social worker.'
Considers taking a stroll at night despite beggars and danger, showing willingness to engage with surroundings beyond his comfort zone.
Refuses to play the social worker role, focusing on his journalist identity, showing clear understanding of his professional role and boundaries.
Considers taking a stroll despite the dangers, showing confidence and some local savvy rather than simply retreating.
Does not immediately accept help or guidance from locals about moving through dangerous areas, indicating some independence and self-reliance.
Pushes through a hostile crowd after being spat on to join Kwan despite discomfort.
Responds to being spat on with a set face rather than anger or aggression.
Expresses doubt about getting used to hostility, showing honest vulnerability.
Pushes through a hostile crowd with a set face to join Kwan despite being jeered at and spat on.
Looks about for Kwan and momentarily thinks he's been deserted, showing a brief uncertainty in the hostile situation.
Becomes absorbed in observing poverty and misery, shows empathy.
Encourages Kwan to give money to the poor, suggesting personal action.
Doubtfully denies naivety but smiles, indicating open-mindedness and a moment of sincerity.
Expresses skepticism that giving money would help, showing some cynicism.
Observes his surroundings carefully and absorbs the contrasting realities of the bazaar and shanty town, showing awareness and thoughtful reflection.
Quotes Tolstoy on poverty and acts as if he understands the complexity, but does not offer a practical solution himself, indicating some intellectual engagement but limited application.
Smiles and hesitates to deny labeling others naive when discussing social change, showing some insecurity or reluctance to fully commit to an argument.
Responds to Kwan's critical remarks about journalists with a calm, somewhat understanding reply: 'You're being a bit hard on the profession, aren't you?'
Reacting somewhat bemused but not dismissive to Kwan's gift of a poem about friendship; he pockets it instead of rejecting it outright.
Shows skepticism and frustration about his difficult situation but remains open to Kwan's assistance despite the negative circumstances.
Accepts help and information from Kwan despite initial skepticism, showing openness and strategic thinking.
Bemusedly puts a slip of paper with poetry in his pocket, indicating possible lack of immediate understanding or underestimation of subtle clues.
Does not immediately realize or act upon the fact his hotel room is bugged, suggesting a lapse in vigilance.
Inquires about protocol (removing sunglasses) before entering the Palace, showing situational awareness and willingness to adapt.
Joins the foreign press corps and interacts with colleagues, tries to observe Sukarno’s actions closely and shows curiosity by peering up at the balcony to get a better view.
Is the only one who doesn't immediately follow the crowd after Sukarno leaves the breakfast terrace, indicating hesitation or caution.
Sees Sukarno wave to him and is surprised and pleased, almost waves back, then hurries to catch up with others.
Pauses to breathe in cool air from air-conditioning after entering from blazing heat.
Narrates thoughtfully about the city poised on the brink of civil war with sincerity and concern.
Notices Sukarno and tries to signal back but then realizes other journalists have left and hurries to catch them.
Observes the political situation and reflects on what he is up against, showing awareness.
Arrives at the foyer drenched and paused to take a breath in cool air, indicating physical strain and possible lack of preparation.
Starts a taped report on a complex political situation with clear, composed narration.
Snaps at Kumar when he calls him 'Boss', hurting Kumar's feelings.
Apologizes to Kumar and offers a cigarette after snapping at him.
Prepares and delivers a radio piece on a complex, politically delicate subject showing knowledge and awareness of the situation.
Perspiring and worried during broadcast, suggesting stress and possible lack of confidence.
Frustrates with a peer's critique and lashes out by snapping at Kumar, indicating poor emotional control and interpersonal skills.
Shows some professional dedication by engaging with material scattered around him and attempting to craft a meaningful report.
Welcomes Kwan on the balcony and responds to his presence without hostility, even declines the offer to return the key politely.
Initially reacts with suspicion and surprise, thinking Kwan might be an intruder.
Uses mild teasing banter with Kumar ('Pull your finger out?') and encourages action with informal language ('Get cracking') which indicates a familiar, straightforward style.
Tells Kumar to 'pull your finger out' and 'get cracking' with confident gestures, showing motivation and drive.
Plans to work a couple of hours and manage logistics (getting a cab) independently, showing some practical planning.
Reacts cautiously and quickly to a perceived threat (thinking someone was an intruder).
Responds hesitantly to question about problems, saying 'It's early days yet...', which may imply uncertainty.
Offers a partnership to Kwan, recognizing his value and showing willingness to collaborate as equals.
Refuses to ask Bantlton for more details about Aidit despite curiosity; respects boundaries and privacy.
Dismisses Potter as a potential partner without malice but favors Kwan, indicating a preference based on personal connection.
Helps Kwan with camera equipment carrying.
Lets out an involuntary whoop of joy and pats Kwan on the back, making Kwan beam with happiness.
Winks at Kwan after interview.
Helps Kwan with camera equipment after interview, showing teamwork and awareness.
Lets out involuntary whoop of joy after successful interview; shows emotional investment but also confidence in achievement.
Winks at Kwan after an exclusive interview; indicates confidence and rapport.
Despite hostile paper reactions, he secured an exclusive interview with the Leader of the Indonesian Communist Party and got a two-column story; demonstrates skill and success in journalism.
Defends his journalistic story against criticism from Curtis with calm reason, showing tolerance for opposing views before flaring briefly.
Squeezes into two columns for a newspaper layout (implying professional accommodation and cooperation).
Suddenly flares at Curtis when challenged, showing some impatience and defensiveness.
Accepts the possibility that Sukarno might allow the communists their own private army, showing open-mindedness and understanding of political complexity.
Sends out a story based on Aidit's interview that others criticize as naive or incorrect, suggesting a lack of critical evaluation.
Defends his reporting confidently against Curtis's accusations, showing assertiveness and belief in his work despite opposition.
Fails to anticipate the backlash or fully understand the political implications of the interview he published, leading to criticism from experienced colleagues.
Joins in the group's laughter along with others.
Declines Curtis's invitation to go to the cemetery with a polite refusal ('Some other time').
Uses a sarcastic or teasing remark calling Curtis a 'necrophiliac'.
Joins in laughter with colleagues in a tense situation, showing social ease and camaraderie.
Declines Curtis's invitation to visit the cemetery, showing discretion and caution.
Remembers the message scrawled on the back of the poem and reacts by looking at others, indicating attentiveness and thoughtful observation.
Appears surprised looking at Kwan after Curtis's remarks, indicating possible lack of preparedness or unawareness in this social dynamic.
Looks anxiously at the dwarf dancing and responds harshly to Curtis calling him a 'stupid fucking clown'
Looks at the dwarf anxiously and responds harshly to Curtis, calling him a 'stupid fucking clown' for bringing the dwarf.
Despite the tense and awkward situation, he maintains control of his emotions enough to continue interacting and not escalate further.
Light-heartedly jokes about air conditioning and a 'decent consecutive choke' while interacting with Kwan, showing informal friendliness.
Refers to Kwan as 'no dwarf' to dismiss Kwan's self-deprecating comment, indicating acceptance and kindness.
Sits with Kwan but they do not look at each other initially, indicating some emotional distance or discomfort.
Questions the practicality of air conditioning in a Javanese bungalow but shows awareness of delicate equipment needs.
Engages in light banter and shows understanding towards Kwan's physical condition and outlook, demonstrating social intelligence.
Does not react negatively or awkwardly to Kwan's self-description and humor about dwarfism, showing emotional competence and confidence.
Smiles at Kwan and shows interest in the photograph of a beautiful girl, indicating sincere curiosity and engagement.
Stares intently at Kwan and asks about the puppet's orientation, engaging with local culture and person in a friendly manner.
Reclines with Kwan under an umbrella, demonstrating relaxed companionship.
Shows interest in small cultural details, questions the puppeteer's display, indicating engagement and observational skill.
Passively allows Kwan to steer him away from further comment on the photograph without asserting or probing.
Engages in polite greetings and handshake with Colonel Henderson, acknowledges compliments on his broadcasts with modest thanks.
Reluctantly refuses a drink offered by the Colonel, maintaining formality without hostility.
Engages in social interaction with the British Military Attaché and maintains composure despite the tense masculine atmosphere.
Reluctant to let personal involvements interfere with his career, showing controlled professional focus.
Declines to join others in drinking, implying a measure of discipline or restraint.
Pointedly takes Colonel's incorrectly ordered drink from the tray to prevent mistake.
Watches Jill with interest and does not interrupt her choice to stay with Billy.
Takes the Colonel's drink off the tray before it can be taken away, intervening politely.
Expresses surprise when the Colonel challenges him to a swimming race.
Lets the Colonel win the swimming race by a small margin after noticing his fatigue.
Keeps pace with the Colonel in the pool and executes a slightly less stylish but effective swim stroke.
Puts in extra effort to draw ahead when the Colonel shows signs of fatigue.
Coasts and lets the Colonel win by a touch despite being capable of beating him.
Compliments Tiger Lily on her coffee, causing her to giggle.
Notices Kumar's financial troubles and quietly gives him money despite Kumar's reluctance.
Responds quickly and cooperatively to an urgent call to action with comrades, sharing a laugh before departing.
Offers money discreetly to help Kumar's father despite Kumar's initial refusal, showing empathy and practical support.
Responds quickly and decisively to urgent news from Kwan about the U.S. Embassy, preparing equipment and rushing to action immediately.
Observes the situation and discusses the political implications with Kumar, showing awareness and a calm demeanor.
Considers the possibility that Kumar might be a P.K.I. member, showing suspicion and critical thinking.
Makes a somewhat dismissive or ironic comment about the confidence of the P.K.I. protesters, which could reflect underestimation of the situation.
Dives at youths attacking Kwan, pushes Kwan hastily into the car, and commands Hortono to get moving to ensure safety.
Suffers a bleeding wound but remains composed and attentive to Kwan’s alarmed state.
Averts his gaze when Kwan admits Jill turned him down.
Discusses Jill Bryant in a somewhat detached and critical manner ('Not my type', 'English can be so bloody superior').
Shows some concern about the situation Jill is in, asking questions about her relationships and the difficulties she faces.
Tests his leg with some optimism saying 'I guess I'll survive'.
Draws conclusions about Jill Bryant's character based on superficial impressions without deeper insight.
Recognizes and discusses social dynamics and relationships around Jill, showing awareness.
Tests his wounded leg gingerly to assess his condition before moving.
Shows limited empathy and understanding toward others' feelings, averts gaze when discussing rejection.
Is observant enough to notice and question about people in photographs, seeking information.
Engages Kwan in conversation, asks challenging questions about his files and gun, shows suspicion but also a willingness to understand.
Says to Kwan 'We make a good team you know. We even look alike.' and acknowledges a perceived similarity in eye color, indicating friendliness and attempt to bond.
Notices the filing cabinet and reads labels carefully, showing attention to detail and investigative skill.
Questions Kwan directly about the files and the gun, demonstrating assertiveness and critical inquiry.
Appears startled upon hearing Kwan's comment about looking alike, which shows a momentary lapse in composure or confidence.
Gives money to Ibu for her baby and young daughter, indicating care and concern.
Gives plain white rice to Ibu, showing practical kindness and thoughtfulness.
Takes photographs of mother and child, potentially intrusive or detached rather than warm.
Passively observes the inevitable spillage without intervening or showing initiative.
Watches events with Curtis and Cook, seemingly relaxed and social.
Stands by the bookshelf talking idly, somewhat detached at a lively party, not engaging much with others.
Struggles repeatedly with the typewriter, ripping papers and missing the waste basket several times.
Insists on putting the wastepaper basket back in its original position despite the inconvenience, showing confidence in his preference.
Calmly manages an interruption from Jill Bryant, attempts polite conversation and offers a ride despite hesitation.
Invites Jill to drive over to Billy's place and to swim there, showing a casual friendly invitation.
Irritated response to Kumar telling him not to call him Boss, shows impatience and slight intolerance.
Responds to Jill's apology about offending him with a light tone and acknowledges her story was good despite its melodrama, showing tolerance and good-natured behavior.
Apologizes after accidentally bumping Jill's knee, indicating sincerity and politeness.
Abandons urbane pose and dashes back to collect coat and keys, suggesting some vulnerability or informal behavior.
Corrects an error about the time he needs to be somewhere (initially thinks 4, is corrected to 3), shows irritation but quickly agrees to be on time.
Decides to cancel a trip to Sydney, showing decisiveness in changing plans.
Fumbles turning on the radio, accidentally bumps Jill's knee, causing awkwardness.
Engages in a conversation that shows awareness of events he witnessed (mentioning rib cages and eyes), showing presence of mind.
Is irritated when called 'Boss' and insists not to be called that, showing some sensitivity but possibly social awkwardness.
Frowns determinedly but breaks into a grin, shows self-awareness and emotional control.
Lets Ralph win a race to be generous and avoid proving anything, showing strategic social awareness.
Moves away embarrassed on seeing photos placed side by side, showing sensitivity but possible discomfort in social situations.
Uncomfortable and glances at his watch, abruptly changing the situation by suggesting going to do interviews, indicating ability to manage time and situations.
Expresses fondness for a small, somewhat eccentric acquaintance despite acknowledging his flaws.
Shrugs off Jill's question about his own role and seems somewhat evasive.
Engages in casual, friendly conversation with Jill, sharing opinions and jokes.
Confidently claims he can get an interview with the top communist in Indonesia, showing initiative and assurance.
Engages in casual banter that reveals some awareness of people’s backgrounds and files, indicating intelligence and awareness.
Shrugs when asked about his role at the embassy, showing vagueness or lack of clear assertion about his own position.
Shares a light moment laughing in the rain and offers to take drinks with them, creating a friendly and easy atmosphere.
Raises a glass in a toast nervously, attempting a small gesture of connection with Jill but not pushing further.
Looks at Jill keenly, causing her to become uneasy, indicating a level of intensity or pressure that reduces comfort.
Raises a glass in a toast to break an awkward moment, showing social awareness and attempting to navigate interpersonal tension.
Does not come up with a better idea than to raise a toast during a moment charged with potential intimacy, indicating limited social finesse or hesitation.
Keeps composure and manages silence and tension in the car after turning off the engine, maintaining calm in an uncertain situation.
Unable to advance the conversation meaningfully with Jill and delays addressing the imminent departure, reflecting some indecision or lack of assertiveness.
Asks to see Jill even after apparent rejection, showing persistence and interest.
Disappointed when Jill leaves without looking back, but does not express bitterness.
Listens to Jill’s critique of his reportage and searches for the exact section, indicating openness to feedback.
Calls Jill to speak with her, leaving a polite and patient message when she is not available.
Listens carefully to his recorded report, searches for a specific critique by Jill, and follows up with a phone call to discuss or resolve the issue.
Responds calmly and respectfully when Jill declines or is unavailable, showing patience and professionalism.
Shows disappointment when Jill declines to engage, but nonetheless accepts it without argument or unprofessional behavior.
Watches Billy conducting but seems distracted by photos of Jill, showing some personal interest.
Refuses to go to the cocktail party despite invitation, possibly indicating social reservation or avoidance.
Watches Billy Kwan conduct but allows his attention to wander over the photos of Jill on the wall, showing distracted behavior.
Refuses to attend the formal cocktail party at the British residence, dismissing it casually despite the presence of an important contact (Jill).
Prepares carefully for a formal event by searching for appropriate clothing and choosing what he can make work, indicating pragmatic resourcefulness.
Hurries for the door after checking himself briefly in the mirror, accepting imperfections without complaint.
Offers a rather crushed looking invitation to the British Aide despite disapproval, showing some humility.
Remains motionless and watches Jill in a socially tense situation, then follows her quietly to the courtyard, indicating respectful interest and patience.
Does a quick self-check in the mirror and adjusts appearance despite limited time; hurries out promptly with keys and cigarettes.
Arrives at the reception and presents a crushed-looking invitation to a disapproving British aide without visible hesitation.
Stands motionless alongside Jill while others dance, carefully watching before following her out to the courtyard.
Remains calm and observant in a tense social situation marked by a curfew announcement and colonial ostentation.
Walks away from Jill abruptly, showing frustration and disengagement.
Slams car door in anger after failed ignition, expressing rage and disbelief.
Allows Jill to get in the car despite earlier tension, indicating some openness or tolerance.
Frustrated by car failing to start but manages to get it running eventually and speeds off promptly.
Leaves abruptly despite Jill expressing urgency, showing emotional impulsiveness rather than calm problem-solving.
Glances at Jill reassuringly during dangerous driving, shares laughter with her amid tension.
Hurtles the car dangerously through a roadblock, maintaining control and composure while impressing his passenger Jill.
Uses the car horn effectively to signal and intimidate soldiers at the roadblock, facilitating quick passage.
Engages playfully with Curtis, shooting the palm of his hand up at his chin and causing Curtis to go sprawling.
Storms out after the playful interaction, showing a quick temper or possible frustration.
Playfully shoots Curtis in the palm of his hand and heaves, causing Curtis to go sprawling, then storms out.
Joins Jill on the landing and receives an unexpected embrace from her.
Sits working at the typewriter while Jill watches silently, showing some distraction but allowing her presence.
Notices Jill searching for a match and calls out to direct her, indicating awareness and slight attentiveness.
Shares a poem given to him by Silly and allows Jill to read it aloud, demonstrating openness and sincerity.
Listens carefully to Jill's warning about the embassy evacuation and the danger he is in.
Refuses to run away despite the risk, showing determination but possibly recklessness.
Acknowledges the need for discretion by promising not to source information back to Jill.
Appears irritated and exhausted upon returning to office, but immediately engages with Billy Kwan, showing commitment.
Is getting nowhere on his investigation about arms shipment, indicating some difficulty or inefficiency.
Insists on obtaining independent confirmation before running a story despite pressure.
Responds calmly to Curtis' excited singing and joining him in drinking at a bar.
Expresses enthusiasm about Curtis going to Saigon, tries to encourage him with positive anticipation.
Chuckles and gently pushes Curtis's fists away after Curtis self-deprecatingly boasts about being a bad bastard.
Engages in confident conversation with Curtis, showing awareness of the significance of the upcoming story in Saigon.
Laughs off Curtis's brashness and keeps the mood light, demonstrating social skill and emotional control.
Repeats Curtis's departure to Saigon, indicating some certainty and knowledge about the situation.
Does not contribute significant information beyond banter, showing limited initiative in advancing the discussion.
Shuts car windows hastily to avoid contact with swarming women and pushes Curtis back to stop him from opening the door, then speeds away from the women.
Stops the car and shakes hands with Curtis, showing concern after the tense episode.
Picks up speed and escapes quickly from the swarm of women after accidentally honking the horn, despite being shaky.
Stops the car suddenly when the women start running towards them again, indicating some hesitation or caution.
Approaches an Indonesian Naval Officer with suspicion and attempts to gather information about a shipment.
Offers money (bribe) to the Naval Officer to gain information.
Gets into a car with Kumar despite Kumar's unease, proceeds with investigation.
Slumps in the passenger seat sleeping off the effects of booze and dope session with Curtis, showing vulnerability and tolerance.
Questions why they are stopping despite having too much work, indicating a sense of responsibility but possibly impatience or lack of flexibility.
Unsure for the first time about what he's got himself into upon arriving at the villa, showing some openness and sincerity in his self-awareness.
Gives Kumar a cigarette and listens attentively, showing calm social interaction and situational awareness.
Does not immediately panic when Tiger Lily disappears underwater but quickly becomes concerned and takes action by diving in to search for her.
Despite swimming skill and searching underwater, he is caught off guard when Tiger Lily unexpectedly pushes him underwater again, causing a dangerous struggle.
Reaches up, seizes the wrist holding him underwater and forces the grip to loosen, showing physical control under pressure.
After a struggle underwater, he manages to surface calmly and tread water while observing Tiger Lily, indicating composure and presence of mind.
Wakes in a stifling room, quickly checks his watch, and opens the shutters wide to allow ventilation, demonstrating alertness and practical problem-solving.
Thanked Kumar politely after receiving information, showing respect and appreciation.
Asked about the approaching danger and planned to move early, indicating concern and responsibility.
Spun car around to avoid confrontation with angry demonstrators, prioritizing safety over escalating conflict.
Calmly questions Kumar to obtain important information without pushing too hard.
Decides to proceed alone when Kumar cannot accompany him, showing adaptability and resolve.
Drives skillfully in a dangerous situation, quickly reacting to a roadblock by braking hard and spinning the car around to escape hostile demonstrators.
Remains tense and fearful inside the car while being attacked by a hostile mob, holding onto the steering wheel doggedly.
Spins the car round and manages to take off before being surrounded by a hostile crowd, skillfully escaping initial danger.
Attempts to find a way out by frantically looking at all the doors when trapped, showing resourcefulness and presence of mind.
Keeps the car running with foot on the clutch while surrounded by a violent mob attempting to overturn the car, demonstrating calmness under intense pressure.
His face breaks into large beads of perspiration and he is pale, indicating fear and stress; although normal, this shows a moment of human vulnerability rather than lack of competence.
Holds doggedly to the steering wheel despite being sure he’s going to die, showing determination and mental resilience.
Hesitates before starting the broadcast, appears weary and distracted, takes a moment before speaking.
Successfully initiates a sensitive news report about a secret arms consignment despite visible fatigue.
Arrives back at the hotel but does not engage with others or show friendly behavior in the scene.
Arrives back at the hotel without incident, navigating a tense environment with armed soldiers and security present.
No direct dialogue or decisive action shown in the excerpt; mostly an observer within a complex political situation.
Commands Curtis to put down Kwan when he is being manhandled, showing concern for Kwan's safety.
Follows Kwan through the crowded bazaar and alley to speak with him, indicating persistence and a desire to communicate sincerely.
Commands Curtis to put Kwan down, demonstrating assertiveness in a tense situation.
Pursues Kwan through crowded and complex environments (car park, bazaar), showing determination and navigation skills.
Pushes through crowds despite distractions and obstacles, maintaining focus on his goal.
Successfully overtakes Kwan in a narrow alley and blocks his way, indicating strategic advantage and control.
Admits to the seriousness of his actions and tries to justify his loyalty conflicts honestly.
Grabs Kwan in frustration and anger after Kwan admits betraying Jill.
Cries out in frustration and rage showing emotional vulnerability.
Watches Kwan leave without trying to follow or reconcile.
Pushes his way towards Jill, takes her arm, leads her to an alcove to speak privately and reassure her about the broadcast.
Watches someone go into the crowds but makes no attempt to follow.
Watches someone leave but makes no attempt to follow or engage further.
Wears a suit and press badge, tries to gain access through security presence confidently.
Pushes his way toward Jill in a crowded foyer and intercepts her effectively.
Makes a broadcast and confirms information directly from a reliable source (P.K.T.).
Does not prevent Jill from leaving even though he wants to continue the interaction.
Stands desolate as Jill leaves, accepting that there's no point in following her.
Stares quietly at an old man in the carpark, showing contemplative observation without interaction.
Stands desolate, knowing he is useless to follow Jill, then turns and leaves the foyer.
Appears surprised and concerned at the unfolding protest and the resulting situation
Runs toward the injured body of Billy
Observes the situation calmly as the banner is hung and the crowd reacts, showing awareness of surroundings.
Runs to the injured body promptly after the incident, indicating responsiveness and decisiveness.
Shouts for a doctor and kneels beside the wounded Kwan, showing concern and urgency.
Ignores soldiers pointing guns at him and refuses to leave Kwan's side, displaying steadfast loyalty and protective behavior.
Shrugs off Condon's hand on his arm, resisting assistance but possibly indicating a desire to maintain control or composure.
Runs toward the body quickly despite danger, shouts for a doctor, kneels beside the wounded person, ignores soldiers' threats to support the victim, and refuses to be moved.
Shrugs off colleague's cautious attempt to intervene, acting independently without clear plan or backup.
Questions the whereabouts of the pistol after learning the man was in possession of one.
Admits he has no idea where McBilly Kwan lived when asked.
Attempts to get Jill's attention in a chaotic crowd by shouting and bursting through, but fails.
Moves directly to burn sensitive files to protect Jill and others.
Embraces Jill in a moment of shared grief and fear.
Willingly offers money to help Jill secure their escape, showing concern for her safety.
Expresses determination to protect Jill even if it means violent measures.
Admits personal failure and disappointment, showing sincerity and vulnerability.
Recognizes the danger Jill is in and immediately decides to help by arranging to get on a flight out, showing quick decision-making and readiness to act under pressure.
Attempts to burn sensitive files to protect them from falling into hostile hands, demonstrating practical problem-solving and situational awareness.
Expresses a resigned, fatalistic attitude about his own safety, indicating possible emotional fatigue or reduced focus on self-preservation, which could compromise his effectiveness.
Confidently tells Jill he will get her on the flight even if he has to 'kill someone,' demonstrating boldness and willingness to take extreme measures to achieve his goals.
Swears to get on the plane in the morning, showing commitment to his goal.
Frantically scoops up the files and tries to escape quickly when danger arrives.
Takes a last look around the room, his attention caught by small details (puppets on the wall), but still hurries out cautiously.
Burns files he is carrying to destroy evidence.
Moves cautiously through a dangerous, tense environment, notices his surroundings carefully, including absence of regular security (doorman), and observes potential threats (beggars, mockers).
Appears to show some hesitation or uncertainty in a risky situation but continues forward.
Stops clearing files, makes a quick decision, and insists on going out to cover the situation despite warnings.
Approaches hostile roadblock alone, styles pleasantly while trying to engage soldiers, despite their silence and hostility.
Clears out files preparing for departure in an orderly fashion.
Hesitates briefly but then decisively races to get his tape recorder and leave, showing prompt decision-making.
Disregards a broadcast warning not to go out, choosing to proceed with the risky action, indicating confidence but possibly recklessness.
Approaches armed roadblocks alone with his tape recorder calmly and politely, showing courage and composure under pressure.
Attempts to communicate with hostile soldiers who ignore him, showing persistence but possible naivety in expecting cooperation.
Attempts to explain his press credentials politely despite language barrier.
Salutes vaguely and walks off to circumvent a roadblock, showing respect to the soldiers.
Hits in the face and half-dragged back but remains composed and does not escalate the situation.
Asks the doctor sincerely about the condition of his eye and listens attentively.
Attempts to communicate with the sergeant despite language barrier, presents press pass confidently, and tries to circumvent the barbed wire to proceed.
Salutes vaguely without fully understanding or engaging properly with the authority figure.
Is caught unaware and physically assaulted by the sergeant; does not successfully avoid confrontation or protect himself.
After injury, tries to instruct Hortono to get a doctor and go to the British Embassy, showing presence of mind despite impaired state.
Accepts care from the matronly amah who feeds him despite his blindness.
Requests the gun from the amah in a tense and fearful situation.
Shows cautiousness and tension when hearing footsteps and voices outside his door, preparing to defend himself.
His calm and attentive listening while blindfolded, hand ready on gun, showing alertness and preparedness despite disability.
Expresses doubt and pessimism about the possibility of saving his eye, indicating limited optimism or acceptance of harsh reality.
Asks questions to confirm the identity and intent of visitors (Kumar), showing cautious, strategic thinking.
Listens attentively to Kumar, responds with calm and consideration to serious news.
Acknowledges Kumar's intelligence and work ethic, calling him 'bloody smart' and expressing appreciation.
Remains silent or unable to answer when confronted with unpleasant questions about social injustice.
Listens attentively and responds calmly to difficult news; maintains composure in tense conversation; shows empathy toward Kumar.
Unable to provide a satisfying answer to Kumar's question about inequality and injustice, indicating some limitation in decisiveness or moral clarity.
Expresses a willingness to help Kumar despite disagreeing with his methods, asking him to drive to the airport and then into the hills.
Responds to Kumar’s question about leaving by bluntly asking if he wants to sit around waiting to die.
Accepts assistance from Kumar to get up from bed and trusts him to help despite the dangerous situation.
Remains silent when challenged, showing inability or unwillingness to provide clear answers.
Expresses desire to help and takes initiative to leave the city despite roadblocks, showing determination and practical problem-solving.
Persistently tries to beat roadblocks with Kumar, demonstrating confidence and resilience.
Wears a bandage over his eye and seems dishevelled, indicating possible physical impairment that might affect his effectiveness.
Pushes Kumar to hurry despite obstacles and expresses frustration with delays, showing urgency and focus but also possible impatience.
Puts a wad of tupiahs (bribe) in the soldier's hand to smooth passage.
Lights two cigarettes, puts one in Kumar's mouth, pushes the pack into Kumar's pocket.
Jumps out of the car and confidently negotiates with soldiers at the roadblock, showing quick thinking by using his press credentials and a bribe to bypass the checkpoint.
Appears anxious and overwhelmed under pressure, evidenced by trembling hands while lighting cigarettes and concern about missing clearance time.
Quickly pushes through the door with suitcase and tape recorder, not hesitating at the airport.
Takes his time walking to the aircraft despite hostess urging him to hurry, showing calmness under pressure.
